I'd like to return next time and sample some of their dim sum along with a few other items.  Until then I think they achieve a solid 3.5 stars.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: My "go to" Chinese take out restaurant.  Reasonable prices, tasty food, good service, never had an order screwed up.  Have eaten there as well and would recommend.  If your family eats dinner early enough, you can do their 3 items for under $22 up until 5pm I think and they throw in a box of rice too.  Great deal for a family of 5 with 3 young children like mine!
author: Dominic L.

description:
Three dishes for 19.99 + house soup, rice, and tea.  What more do I have to say?  
Our usual three dishses: Eggplant with shreded pork, salt and pepper chicken wings and salt pepper ribs.  Add on a beef chow fun or a house chow mein and you are good to go to feed 6-7 people for under $40.00.
We came upon this place a few months back and we have been regulars ever since.  Portions are a good size, the service is good, and the food taste pretty good.  
Parking is average - street parking; Wait time at lunch - within 5 minutes
Cooking time - extremely fast! A great place for lunch and dinner!!
author: Nathan N.

description:
This is a review for their take out ONLY.  The bathrooms are yech.. so I will do a dining experience review later.  Also fyi: there was a change of management during the year...

OK - At this place, for take out, you get more than enough. They have a $5 list and my favorite is diced chicken with tofu over rice.  $5.  For that price, it is definitely worth it.  Also the speed they can have it at the counter is remarkable.  I called and said I was in a hurry and had a movie to catch allll the way down to Van Ness.  Think the Beach and traveling to AMC 1000. I just got off the sand with Charlie (best Yorkie around) and the restaurant was maybe 3 minutes away.  By the time I got sand out of Charlie and drove to the restaurant (6 minutes MAX) , it was ready!!!  oh yea, did a cursory view of the parking situation... didn't look good so glad I didn't eat in (just double parked and ran in - the street was not busy which is great being on Balboa versus Irving or Taraval or those crazy traffic'd streets.)
author: Andrea K.

description:
I wanted some yum chaa with my old high school friend and I was recommended to come to this place. 

We got there at like 12:45ish almost 1. And I guess you can't get dim sum plates around that time which SUCKS cause I was craving HAA GAO and HAA CHERNG (the shrimp dumpling and shrimp thick noodle thing) so we got won ton soup, potstickers, eggrolls, and some other stuff. But everything was really greasy and nasty tasting. 

Not coming back.
author: Sophia G.

description: Holy crap us this place busy or what! This is one of my parents' go to place since we live a block away. I've never really had a bad experience here even when it was under a different name. Great staff with typical Chinese restaurant mannerisms (rushed but polite). You know it's good when Asian families are lining out the door for some delicious, delicious gddhkkbbddmm. Sorry, I can't finish the review, it's considered rude to be on your phone at the dinner table.
author: Tiffaney L.

description: went here on Mother's Day for take out order a lot of food and its going to be a lot left over food is so good they hook you up with a lot of food you should try this place out  It better for you to make reservation at this place gets really packed. 10 stars to them again!!
author: D D.

description:
I've been here maybe 4x since it's opened and was not impressed any of those times.

The first time was during opening week and they seemed to not have anything.  Why bother to open if you the kitchen is not fully stocked?!

The second time was a month after opening.  Although we were able to order off the full menu, their food was not that great.  A lot of their dishes were really greasy.

I went there with my coworkers for dim sum yesterday and again was not impressed.  The food is by no means bad but with all the yummy and cheap dim sum places in the city, Empero Taste does not hold up much of a competition.  I'd much rather walk two more blocks down to KL for some much yummier dim sum.

Sorry to say, but I probably won't be coming back again unless someone in our group insists on going there =/
author: Katelynn L.

description:
A quickie review: 

Dinner here is slightly above mediocre...the price isn't bad but I don't think I would go out of my way to eat here unless I was craving for the ginger and green onion lobster over noodles, which I think are good....not AMAZING though. Service is sub-par but you can't expect too much service from any Chinese restaurant. If you go, definitely try the lobster with noodles...it's available in a few different sauces. I've only had it with the ginger and green onion...that would be the only reason why I would drive out of my way there.
author: Nicole S.

description:
Ok maybe Dim Sum is good and cheap but you get what you pay for.  This is my exp at dinner this past Sat night.  This place has pretty decent food.  Not bad but not great either. 

My family wanted to take my uncles/aunts with our respective families to have dinner for Chinese new years.  We called in to get 2 big tables to fit everyone so they know we would be eating a lot.  We got our tables but we were short 5 chairs.  Uhhh how are we going to eat?  Servers told us to wait and stand because they didn't have enough chairs.  How can you not have enough chairs?!?!?!  Ok that started off not being a good exp but hey they were a bit busy so I can let that one slide.  

Throughout dinner service, they never once check on us to get us more tea.  When you pound down greasy food, you need tea to wash it down.  We had 10 at each of the 2 tables so those little tea pots aren't going to be enough tea for everyone. 

Grr so now end of dinner comes and they said sorry no desert.  WHAT?!?!? ok so maybe no red bean soup at the end .. how about some oranges?  None.  Ok well how about some fortune cookies? NONE!!! omfg and then they add insult by slapping an auto gratuity?!?!?!? Yeah at that point I was pretty pissed.  My dad was just going to pay it but I walked up and had a talk with them.  They decided to let US decide on the tip.  My dad ended up tipping them anyways but honestly I felt they deserved nothing for a tip.  I get that Chinese restaurants usually have bad service but this was unbelievable.  

Needless to say, I'll never be back here.  Tell everyone and their mothers that this place has extremely crappy service.  If i could give negative stars, this would be the place.
author: Allan T.

description:
Dinner Review only:

My family and I (4 ppl) came here on a chilly Sat. night for dinner at 7:30pm. This place was packed inside like sardines and even families waiting outside! People were just hovering over tables, salivating while waiting for their own table! 

We ordered, I had a sip of tea and the food was out, wow, that was QUICK service! 
So what did $38 prefix get us?
Westlake Beef Tofu Soup- it was ok, kind of bland, definitely not loaded with MSG.
Peking Spareribs- yum, my favorite of all the dishes, some good quality meat, not the typical red/orange flavored sauce covered in fat ribs!
Garlic Steamed Surf Clams x4- overcooked! 
Deep Fried Quailsx4- not marinated long enough or seasoned as well.
Seafood w/mustard green- typical cantonese dish, pretty good!
Dessert: red bed tapioca tong sui, tasty! 

Ok, why the 4 stars?! My MOM approved it, she loved it, couldn't stop smiling! This is what she would say: Pang, lang, jang place!! (cheap, quality, awesome food!) 


Check this out, there was a table of 5 behind us and they ordered the $128 prefix for 10ppl. The meal came with an appetizer platter (jellyfish, cha siu, etc.),shrimps, soup, sandab, pork spareribs, mushrooms over green, a HUGE whole crispy chicken, a MOUNTAIN of ginger and green onion lobster and crab, something else and fried rice! The plates just kept coming and the folks kept eating! haha.. It was pretty funny to watch! 

Most Cantonese Chinese restaurants are known for BIG plates of food but man, this place takes it to a whole new level, it's GINORMOUS!! 

Tip: 
*Go in large groups 6+ppl so you can experience the bazillion course meals, however we did get a table pretty fast since there was ONLY 2 4-5ppl TABLE! 
*Don't expect to come to this place treated like a queen! 
*If you don't know what to order from the menu just do the prefix, it's worth it! $25 for 3ppl to $388 for 10ppl

Can't wait to try it with again with my friends!! =)
author: Leeseuh K.

description: Good Chinese food for good prices (especially the huge lunch specials for $5 each). Nothing special, though.
author: Trisha D.

description:
Weeknight dinner was recommended and invited by my brother & sister-in-law. I've been here before awhile back, Best Panda I think. Located way out near 42nd ave. be advised that  parking is a challenge! Dinner before 6 pm is always a good time, as getting a large table is easy and no waiting for a group of 7.

The specials were 3 items for about $20, a good value and a very large menu to chose from. However, they charge steam rice as per person, now that's crazy! Maybe to off set the cost of the special?? Anyway, you can always skip the steam rice and order fried rice instead (they got you either way). 

As always, we tend to go with a good variety of entrees. We order:
-complimentary house soup which consisted of pork broth & morsels of meat, bitter melon & peanuts, a must if your Chinese!! 
-salt & pepper fried pork chops, always a favorite, nicely fried and satisfying
-fish with corn sauce, batter fried fish nuggets infused with a light corn sauce
-whole flounder, yes, again fried in a light batter, very delicate, just watch the fine bones and don't choke on it....
-hainan style poach chicken, very moisted and silken like texture, my favorite dish! nice ginger & garlic condiment, mixed in in with your rice...yummm
-eggplant and onions chow to tenderness over tofu cubes, a good way to get you veggies n' calcium for the day
-mixed veggies with chinese vermicelli, bok choy, straw mushrooms, celery, broccoli, yes, more veggies!
-tomato & beef chow-mein, OK, sure...not authentically chinese, but hey, it was my nieces birthday!! (symbolic of long life and traditional)
Overall a very good dinner, as we were there for 2 hours and there was still more people flowing in, a good sign that its a good dining spot if you can find parking!
author: Wolfy W.

description:
So I have since been back to Empero a few times for dim sum. Everything is still good. I'm bumping them up a star since I've gotten takeout for dinner. 

What a bargain for dinner too! I guess it must have been the peak of crab season when I stopped by about 3 weeks ago, because the crab was sooo cheap! $10 for a crab cooked with ginger and green onion. Simple way of preparing it, but delicious and the crab was HUGE. The bf and I got a $10 crab and a $6 fried rice to share for dinner. Dinner for 2 including a whole crab for under $20?!? And there was enough food for leftovers too! It's hard to top such a good value. And yes, the crab was good.  I think the price has gone up to $13 for a crab now. Uh, yeah that's still cheap. I'll be back.
author: Jessie C.

description: So disappointed.  First Bay Fung Tong closed and sent everyone here, then they changed owners and the menu.  Very sneaky, very sad demise of delicious food. Folks keep coming to town asking to be taken back - never more!
author: Maggie L.

description:
So, this is the place to dine because they are reasonable and the food is decent.

My family and I were here a few weeks ago for dinner and it was a VERY cold winter night.  We sat near the door, which sucked because it was pretty packed that night.  There were about 2 tables open, but of course they were near the door of the restaurant.  So, every time someone came through those doors, a big gush of wind would go right through those doors.  We couldn't stand the cold so we didn't bother to eat there because for some reason the owner didn't bother to turn on their heat that night. So, we decided to go to another restaurant to patrionize them because Empero taste didn't have eat.  Everyone dining in that restaurant looked like they were eskimos cause it was freezing and they had layers of clothes on!

We were hear once again for dim sum today.  It was a bit on the cold side, but not as cold as it was a few weeks ago for dinner.  Once again they didn't turn on the heat.  My bf and I looked at the ceiling to check out the central heating and guess what?!?!?  They sealed it off with some sort of plastic....looks like they refuse to turn on their heat for their customers.  And yes, people still had some layers of clothing on, but not as much as that night.

Food in general was still darn good.  I'll definetely will be back to support you Empero taste, but not during the winter season!!!
author: Shana W.

description:
Street parking only, corner of 42nd and Balboa. Two dining areas (large flat screen in one of them), pretty good service, okay tasting food. Went here for a large banquet of 40 people. We had salt & pepper crab (overcooked), steamed chicken, steamed rock cod, honey walnut prawns, etc.   Food was mediocre and the portions decent, but there was nothing setting this place apart from other Chinese restaurants. 

As another Yelper has mentioned, the whole restaurant was cold with no heat. They had plastic panels and cellophane on top of their emergency exit doors (which were chained and slide bar locked, against the fire code?) where a glass pane window should have been. It was a really poor make-shift job of trying to block the outside air from coming in, so the cold wind was blowing in all night.   Not a comfortable way to eat, eating in 45 degree temperature with your jacket on. No matter how good the food is, they need to correct that issue soon. 

There were no dishes that I remember as being outstanding and above average.  I would go here again if I was in the area, but it's not a place where we would say "we have to go again" and go out-of-our-way to eat there.  Just remember to bring a warm coat if it's foggy and cold out.
author: Larry G.

description:
Don't be fooled by the name of the restaurant. The food quality was very basic when my family and friend went for dinner. 

We ordered a good number of dishes only to find out half of them were out of ingredients that were needed to complete those dishes. The employees are not very attentive to the customers but rather the large flat panel that is playing Cantonese dramas and/or the news in Cantonese. I watched as another large table had to literally wave their hands as if seeking a helicopter for survival to get someone's attention at the counter. I can hardly remember what we ate but I do remember one dish which was the BBQ pork pan-fried noodle. It was alright but the meat was not the best and the sauce was a bit lacking. The Westlake soup had absolutely no flavor! I had to resort to adding tablespoons of pepper in every bowl I drank to finish the big bowl. I know, very bad for health, but isn't all Chinese food bad for the respiratory system?

I do want to give this place another chance because the potential for it is there but just that one night was very unlucky for me and my family.
author: Dominic T.

description: Dinner for 7 including 9 course banquet plus fresh prawns and 2 Yang Chow fried rice, 8 beers, 2 sodas, $154 and I left a $40 tip.  This place is so authentic I am surprised they take CC.  Lo Fan guests didn't like the shrimp heads, but everything else was Good to Go!  Waitresses are nice and pleasant.  The Chef is very flexible and will put anything on the menu over rice or noodle of your choice.  Dessert was an interesting sweet soup with white fungus and mango and egg.  Tired of tourist food?  Tired of Tourists. Checkit out.
author: Tim L.

description:
I would give this place ZERO stars!

If you make a reservation, you would think the tables you reserved for would be ready +/- 15 minutes...  This place had the tables ready...but you'll have to STAND to eat...b/c they don't have enough chairs for the restaurant!!  We were missing 7 chairs -- so we had to wait for other diners to leave before we get seated...

I was so tempted to drive home and bring my own chairs!  -- it would've been a lot quicker....

Then..they run out of dessert and fruits?  Not even one orange?  c'mon... Not even fortune cookies???  :P

....so dumb...
author: Lise T.

description:
I finally came to Empero for dinner and I must say I think it's a pretty good place with tons of food.  I was quite empressed.  We ordered the dinner for 8 for $108 and had more than enough leftovers.  We had seafood soup, clams, crab, quail, chicken, walnut prawns, steak cubes, and a whole bunch of other stuff I can't even remember.  All I know is that the plates just kept coming out and we could hardly finish a dish.  

The staff is just typical but I thought the food portions were so generous and quite tasty.  I've been to a few other places in the RIchmond and they were just too dirty for me to ever go back to.  I guess since it's still fairly new, it's a little bit "safer" for now.
author: Stacey C.

description: Food is very good...but the service this last Sunday was the worst I ever experienced. The guy had an attitude like placing an order was an imposition to him. But the food was very fresh tasting and maybe well try to go back on a weekday night...
author: Diana D.

description: was there tonight tring to take avantage of their recent promo of get 3 dishes, rice & soup for $19.95, well as it turns out if you don't know how it works,  only offered till 5 pm, did that help me? No, it didn't, so beware that if you think u can take advantage, think again, what a ploy to get you in there. Foood isn't that great, beef was tough as jerky, soup was cold & came out during my meal. one last thing, walked out smelling  like you cook for them, bad ventilation, they have no range hoods in their kitchen running. WILL NOT RETURN.
author: david c.

description:
Pretty solid food!  I think the waitstaff is also pretty nice, so overall I always enjoy my family dinners here.  

But maybe my palette is tainted by too much American food these days that I can't tell what constitutes as good Chinese food.  My parents said that the food we had recently was not fresh and that the white chicken wasn't yellow enough... but instead a darker slightly purple color.  Wtf does it mean when chicken is dark?  

Either way, those table dinners are really worth it!  I also saw tons of dishes that were less than $6, so it seems like a cheap place to get take out to eat for days.  

Also, it's a lot cleaner than back when it was Best Panda, so upgrade!
author: Anna T.

description: Horrible services!!!! We had 5 people(3 adults and 2 kids)  1st waitress tried to sit us by the door... On a windy and raining night... I told her no can we be seated away from the door since it was cold... Okay hold on... 2nd waitress tried sitting us at the same table... No that table is too close to the door... Okay hold on..... 3 waitress look at us for bout 5 mins .... They finally sat us down... Sit down we look through the menu... Cheap great lets eat... We flag down a waitress... We are ready to order ... Waitress tells us... She cant take our order because its not her section.... Okay fine... We tried to flag down OUR SECTION waitress.... IGNORED!!! Really... Okay got up and left.... HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!!
author: jeannette L.

description:
Blah came back a few months later, the food felt rushed even though it wasn't busy at the time. the dishes that were supposed to be crispy fried kinda came out a little soggy. 

So on a stormy Saturday afternoon I came to pay homage to a awesome man my dad. We came here for a solemn meal to a quiet place to chow down some seafood. This place was formerly Best Panda, which the dad sold it to the son. The food was above par . I had ordered the $128 set meal which had 9 courses. First off was a cold platter with jellyfish ham bacon (chines style) , soup, a few seafood dishes. The one that missed kinda bad was salt and peppered skrimp, it seemed not to be  fried crispy enough and not a lot of taste. The rest turned out great , portions are nice sized. Its hard to find a deal like this in Chinatown and parking is way easier out by the beach. If you need to do a banquet for any occasion this would be it.
author: Jorm K.

description:
Fresh, tasty seafood.  And cheap too!

A bit greasy, but that's kind of normal for most Chinese restaurants.

I keep coming here for their fresh steamed seafood.  Their family set menus are a great deal and your tummy will be filled with happiness when you're done.
author: Winnie C.

description:
When this restaurant first opened, my family and I went there about once every 2 months.  I also took some friends there and they were impressed with the service and the quality of the foods.  

 I have not been there for about a year and has recently went back again with my family for a Chinese New Year celebration dinner.  The service and quality of foods have certainly deteriorated.  

They take reservation, but do not honor it.  We made reservation for 7:30 pm and our party arrived at 7:20 pm, but were not seated until 8:30 pm.  During the time when we were waiting, the host was chatting with his friends while tables were left uncleaned.  We were constantly being told "soon" every time we checked with him on how long it would take before we can be seated.      

After we finally sat down, they gave us a tea pot, but forgot the cups and menus.  
After our order was finally placed, they brought out the soup and bowls for the soup, but forgot the spoons.  We had to remind them twice to give us spoons while the soup was getting cold. 
We ordered a set meal and one of the dish is onion with lobster.  They totally forgot about this dish until we reminded them; then, they brought out a dish of crab saute with onion.  When we reminded the waiter that our order comes with lobster and not crab.  He told us that they ran out of lobster.  So they just replaced our lobster with crab without bothering to tell us and charged us the same price.  There were so few pieces of crab on the plate that I was not even sure whether we were given the whole crab.
author: Rocky B.

description: I wish i never went there. i got harsh food poisoning. Wish I kept the receipt as my attorney said I can sue them for all my medical phone bill. Also heard that this place is a money laundering scheme for drug business. God I hope they didnt mix the food with drugs by mistake or something.
author: P N.

description:
empero has a weekday special for dim sum whereby all smalls, mediums, and large are priced at 1.80

dim sum review only:
-bbq bun(s):nice fluffy bun with well prepared bbq paste-marvelous!
-har gow(3/med):made with shrimp pieces , forgettable
-meat balls)3/s) - tender, ok 
-chicken claws(4/s): tender but otherwise unnoteworthy
-spareribs(s):bony and chewy meat. so-so juicy
-sweet rice in lotus leaf(L): mushrooms, meat, and dried shrimps?  . order this and take it home. suitable for dinner or breakfast
-shrimp in roll rice (K-3.50) shrimp seem dried out. not tasty, rice roll gummy, not perfect.
-gratis soup, pretty tasty, unusual for dim sum house.

leftovers
-order by checklist, dim sum will come out slowly
-overall, most dim sum items were poor, but a few stellar items stood out.
-free street parking a block away.
-don't expect much service unless you ask and ask.
-bathroom (men's) doorknob is dysfunctional.
-chow fun (4.50?) seems reasonable but didn't try.
author: Victor G.

description:
Brought my family from NY here and everyone loved this place!  Dinner was $140 for all 13 of this!!!! And we lift with ALOT of left overs.  Don't know how they do it.  
***Then we went back for Dim Sum the next day which was $1.50 a plate! And it's not that dim sum that you get from tiny togo places.  The food quality is just as good as any of those more expensive places over on Geary and Clemente.
author: Sylvia K.

description:
Budget dim sum, ftw!  $1.80 dim sum, M-F from opening to 3pm is made to order here.  Sorry folks, no carts, but at least food comes out fresh and hot.  The dim sum is not too bad considering the price.  They also have a selection of more expensive dishes that are delicious too.  I love the free soup they give.  It's very light and is a great opening for all the grease that's bound to come when the dim starts arriving.  The tea is free there too.  I only wish that they had a larger selection of deep fried dim sum dishes.  But this place deserves credit for better than average dim sum at great prices.

Be careful to watch for the street cleaning signs as my friend got a ticket for not checking.  And, yes, I wouldn't recommend going around the restaurant to check on the kitchen as it will turn you off, LOL.

My Dim Sum Rating System:
Egg-rolls=4
Pan-fried turnip cake w/ XO sauce=5
Rice noodle roll w/ fried bread stick=4
Shanghai dumplings=3
Shrimp dumpling=4
Spicy salted tofu=5
author: B F.

description:
I lived right across the street from this place for a year and this place is great. I am a believer that the best ethnic food places are generally frequented by those who traditionally eat the food, and at Empero Taste this rings true. Parking during dinner on any day is impossible because of the Chinese families packing the restaurant, but it is right on the Balbo bus line. Hardly any of the waiters speak English, but communicating your order is no problem. 

After hours it gets more interesting. Several times the noise from this place woke me up from a dead sleep. The people who work there seem to love to party and dance after work....
author: Sarah B.

description:
Really bad service. 

Food is alright. Got a bunch of the typical dimsum items plus a few extra main dishes. 

The salted spicy squid was really good, but also really greasy. The pork sparerib was average. Nothing really stood out about this place to me.
author: Mike I.

description:
My gal is a homie, so we were served fast and attentively even though the place was completely packed with a line out the door. We had the dinner for 3 for $28 (even though there were just the two of us) and the food was very good and an excellent deal. It was more like dinner for 4! The sizzling rice soup had shrimp and scallop, and the vegetables in it were fresh, and the soup wasn't too salty, a fine starter. Then there was braised beef with picked vegetables, a cold platter that we enjoyed a lot. The three main dishes came rapid fire. The chicken with black bean sauce was flavorful and not overly oily, but the chicken was low quality with chicken bone bits in it.  The stuffed eggplant with garlic was excellent. 2 very large eggplants stuffed with fish cake, and whole garlic cloves. A unique dish. Then tofu with chili and pork, a classic dish done fine. All the dishes were very large with no holding back on ingredients. Dessert was included, which was a simple red bean soup. 

This place was the previous Best Panda which I wasn't so crazy about, but apparently this is the same owner, and the place was remodeled inside to now be very nice. I was amazed driving down Geary how so many restaurants on a sunday night at 7pm had barely any people and when we came up upon this restaurant out in the boonies of Balboa and it was so incredibly packed...something must be right about it.

Parking is a bitch, but I'd gladly come back.
author: Henry Y.

description: This is the second time we've been to this restaurant and the food is really good it's inexpensive and the food It's really tasty.  We love their chow fun n jook not to mention their very generous portions.  So if you have a hankering for really good simple Chinese food this is the place to go.
author: Jeni F.

description:
The people who have given this a bad rating well lets just say I feel they are a little picky! COME ON!!! Seriously pull the stick outta your butt!

as far as Chinese food goes this place is very good the French style beef is fantastic and the pineapple and prawn fried rice goes great with it we get it every time we go, I have been to this place about 10 times with a group of 2 - 6 and the service is always great & and food always is consistent.

You might ask why I give this 5 stars I base all my reviews on the area they are in I feel this place falls into a cheaper end Chinese restaurant BUT it feels more mid end one, the prices are great and the portions are large. 

Last time I went with my fiancée and her mother who are Chinese we had 6 dishes and 3 of them were seafood one being lobster! the bill come to $60 HOW CAN YOU GO WRONG????

it is a clean place and you can always get a seat never waited more than 5 mins and you can talk it is not too noisy. 

Give it a try it is great food!
author: Mark H.

description:
Let me just by saying DO NOT GO HERE. This place is questionable for multiple reasons.
 The staff is your typical kind of staff that you find at most Chinese restaurants in the area. Nothing special. Just kind of take you order and walk off and not really check back if you need anything. You'll also probably have to ask a few times if you need something. It seems they have selective hearing.

They also dump all their garbage and leftover food outside onto the sidewalk. The sidewalk seems to be permanently stained and reeks of rotten fish and other undistinguishable odors.

For a while they also had the letter m backwards on their sign...Do they know how to spell.....? It has since been changed after being that way for over a year. (Look at the picture! Hopefully they don't change it lol)

Basically do not go here. It's not worth the stomach ache you'll get later from the food.
author: Sarah G.

description:
This review was base on the lunch items and not the dinner.  This can easily be a 5 star restaurant if you ordered the right things. It's a new dim sum restaurant that just opened up. Heard from Jennifer H that this place was cheap and good. Since I work close by, I decided to come here today with a few of my workers. Brought 5 big guys so that we can sample everything.  There were plenty of seats available and there was plenty of parking spaces outside.  I guess because it is a weekday.

Salt and pepper calamari.........probably one of the best in the city 
XO chow fun............couldn't Taste the XO but the dish was great 
sticky rice in lotus leaf was good 
chicken feet was not good 
har gow was not good 
beef roll the noodle was too thick 
shrimp roll the noodle was too thick 
pan fried taro was good 
fried taro with xo sauce was good.........had better
fried tofu was good 
XLB was ok 
2 vegetable dishes 
black bean sauce spare ribs ok 

So the overall experience was a three star. Adding one star because of the price. You can add another star if you didn't order the har gow, the beef roll, chicken feet. 

The place is very clean because it just opened up.  

1.80 for s m l plates on weekdays only.  Well worth it.

total for 5 guys was 50 dollars
author: jason g.

description:
My mom likes this restaurant a lot. We live clear across town, and she is willing to drive MILES and waste a lot of gas to eat here. We've eaten here a couple of times (for dinner) and it's been great. They were accommodating -- when we came here the first time with no reservations, they gave us a table anyway. A huge plus in my book. 

Food: The steak cube dish IS AMAZING. I'm addicted to it. They don't have anything like that at 8 Immortals.  The clay pot dishes are super good too, and pack a lot of flavor. I usually have to restrain myself from eating a lot here or I'll gain weight. Fast. 

Service: Fast. The dishes came out like this: boom. bang. shawahhh. oohh! You get the picture. 

The only gripe I have is the seating...it's a little cramped. It gets super uncomfortable when the place is packed, and that's usually around dinner time.
author: Betty T.

description:
what we ordered...peking spareribs, steamed live whole fish, spicy salted spare ribs, black bean sauce clams, yang chow fried rice, wonton soup.

CHEAP AND LOT'S OF TASTY FOOD....what else do you want?

a place like this not many want's to say good stuffs about or even say something cause they want it to be a secret,..... greedy ass bastards.

...though the restaurant is a typical chinese joint. not  a neat place but tolerable and service?... you're definitely in mainland china.
author: Gors P.

description:
I loved this place before it became Empero Taste when it was called Best Panda. According to my Asian friends the real name used to be "good soup" or some derivation of that and the truth was it was good soup, very good soup. This is a no frills kind of restaurant, or was, it's a bit "nicer" now as they painted it, removed the scent of raw ingredients that wafted freely out of the kitchen, and looks like they bought some new plates and what not. Happily the menu remains mostly the same:

Dong Po Pork - otherwise known as pork and preserved mustard greens - AKA Chinese Bacon! I ordered this once and the waiter looked at me side long and said "very fat" thanks, I know I'm a little chunky, I thought to myself, and then paused to appreciate this guy's concern for my arterial flow. Yeah I know its fatty and I want it, and I'll eat it all right here right now! The pork is out of this world, and its very fatty and the preserved mustard greens on which the swine rests is out of this world.

The surf clam is a madman, ginger, scallion, little corn starch sauce, garly and slipper bits of clam that are served on an abalone shell.

All the vegetables on the menu are always well done but especially wonderful are the "su-choy" and "an-choy" and naturally the pea sprouts which are always bloody pricey but more than flavorful. 

The deep fried sand dab with soy sauce is great. It's a whole plate o' fishy fried goodness that comes straight out of the frier. Very tasty and fun for the kiddies to pick apart.

Salt & Pepper shrimp/spare ribs - oh yeah oh yeah oh yeah... 

All parties are in agreement that the Mu-Shu Pork is orgasmic. It's so good you don't need the plum sauce or the wrappers. I love to eat it just as it comes, by the bloody table spoon full. I'm glad the chop sticks are there to limit the gluttony, it slows me down just enough to keep from choking and allows me to breathe.

Its probably a good thing that I don't live 1 block away from this place as I'd have surely wound up on a gurney or had a stroke from the salt, but this is by far my favorite place for a well cooked Chinese meal that is ridiculously cheap, generous in terms of portions has a mostly friendly staff that understands just barely enough English so that you only have to repeat yourself twice.
author: Len S.

description: Great place for the set menu dinners for large parties. The portions are very generous and the prices reasonable. Lots of Asian families come in and the place can get full especially during the weekends. Service is what I'd expect, it's okay.
author: K. G.

description:
- Beef chow fun, dry style
- Shanghai steamed dumplings
- Black bean chicken feet
- Stir-fired string beans
- Salt and pepper chicken wings

Total = $17.03 

For 2 people this was a huge amount of food. Overall everything was tasty and good. 

It was about 1:30, so service wasn't too bad. Not the most attentive but they did clear away empty plates fairly regularly. 

They did run out of the complimentary house soup which they serve at lunch and they ran out of the Chinese broccoli. Not  a big deal as the string beans were so good!

Clean, modern looking and cheap. That puts them above a lot of other restaurants.
author: cyndi L.

description: This place is right by my house, so my family and I would always come here for dim sum or for dinner at night. It's regularly price and tastes decent/good. I really have nothing to rave about, nor anything to complain about. Everything is pretty oily, but that just comes with all Chinese food when you eat out.
author: Diana L.

description:
Empero Taste 

The Bottom Line: New Chinese joint offers decent food at decent prices. Things were slightly above average for your typical Chinese Restaurant. Its an okay place to go, but not something to RAVE about. Also they have room for plenty of people. Oh lastly, watch the MSG, there's a decent amount of it.

Being that I don't eat seafood, I can't comment on a lot of dishes that were served. However, they look delicious and the rest of my family seemed to enjoy them so I'll just assume they were good. The dishes I had were good had like an egg drop/tofu/ shrimp soup which was nothing to rave about but again a good solid dish. Salt and Pepper spare ribs aka MSG spare ribs were about the same as anywhere else. 

Not much to say about the service, typical of a Chinese restaurant.
author: Steven C.

description:
Not bad place to eat if you are not sensitive to the MSG levels (extreme thirst and major migraine) they put in their foods like the deep fried calamari. Service is attentive and fast as is the food service in this busy place...they definitely want you in and out like it was a panda express. 

if you want a more chill experience, i would seek another recommendation. if you are on the run, then check this place out if you are not MSG-sensitive...
author: Jessie M.

description: Close to home and good food for a good price.  Its worth it to order take out and save trouble of making dinner if your not in the mood...  Dinner is served in 15 mins  :)
author: Lai L.

description:
We ate here twice this week - dinner mid week and dim sum on the weekend.  The food was delicious, service good, prices cheap on both visits.  Some highlights:

Dinner: Really happy with the quality, especially given the size & price.
 - chicken claypot with vermicelli was fantastic.
Dim Sum: Good mix of standard and unusual items.  Dishes are made to order.
 - salty spicy tofu was perfectly crispy and the lightest ever
 - lettuce with bean sauce was a surprise (the good kind!)
 - fresh wrappers for Shanghai steamed dumplings and pot stickers
 - beef cubes with french sauce!

Nitpicking - the lighting at dinner was too bright, and how hard is it to serve the Shanghai dumplings with a spoon?  

I'll be totally happy to go there again.
author: Stefan A.

description:
Came here for lunch today with bf and his parents. His parents always dim sum here so they suggested us coming here since his mom had the day off. 

I think they remodeled this place. It looked really bright when we first walked in. We got seated pretty quickly and the food came fast too. We ordered chicken feet, some egg yolk bun, fook kin fried rice, shrimp in flat rice noodles, tripe, and sweet tofu. 

The chicken feet and fook kin fried rice was sooooo goood! But oh man.....WARNING: DO NOT ORDER THE SWEET TOFU! When I put that spoonful of sweet tofu in my mouth I was about to throw it back up. It's not even tofu! It tasted like instant powder sh*t added with milk or something. Totally not worth the $1.80 =T Other than that the other food was great, cheap prices, and clean environment.
author: Tracy A.

description:
Great food and great prices!! They got quite an interesting selection of food on their menu. From clay pots, to hot pots, to dinner entrees, to lunch specials.  They give lots of quantity of the food (more for your bucks) 

Fast customer service, food is served fast, and utensils are clean. Prices of the quality of the food is hard to beat. If there only is more parking around the neighborhood, I would go there more often. =)
author: Lelan Q.

description:
This is one of my favorite chinese restaurants in the city. I may be biased because its so close to my house.. or because they are so cheap. 

The food is consistantly delicious, and they give you A LOT for the price. 
The honey walnut prawns are AMAZING here. They are not too creamy or sweet like most places... 
The orange chicken is my favorite, its nice and crispy with delicious flavor. 

You could easily eat for cheap. Go with a bunch of friends and share dishes at their big round tables.  You could easily order 2 dishes/person and get out for less that $20/each. 

My husband and I like to order take out because we always have leftovers..  I just wish they delivered.
author: Mary Eleanor C.

description:
Looks like I have to knock down the ratings for this place.  My last visit here was for dinner and everything we had lacked taste.  The only thing that was really good was the fish soup.  But other than that, the rest of the food was bland and even the lobster noodle was very small.  Definitely a lot less noodles given than most places I've had this dish.  

Surprisingly, it was very crowded on a late Sunday night.  Since it was this crowded, I was expecting a great meal but it definitely underperformed compared to my last visit here.
author: Mark W.

description:
i ate here yesterday. oh man the name is awesome. I thought hte 'r' had fallen off, but then I looked to the right and it said 'Empero' on a printed sign as well. i had to get to the bottom of it. was it a spelling error? Was it slang to take off the last r in emperor?

Thanks to wikitionary, i now know its a spanish adverb meaning "nevertheless". Duh, Of course it means Nevertheless taste... Stupids.

Alright despite the bad spelling error of a name, i actually thought this place was legit. My pops and I talked to the owner for a bit. He remolded the place (used to be Panda Express or something like that (not the chain)). But it's nice looking, clean, but the old construction workers still eat here for lunch. That's how yah know it's still cheap and good. We got the standard dishes, some type of chow fun and salted pork chop over rice.

Good stuff. I think its one of the better asian restaurants. For the price, it owns 8 immortals and D&A.
author: Garrett W.

description: Food is ok. Parking is hard. Two stars because we ordered a steamed live fish and the freaking owner gave us a Dead one. We can tell from the way the meat tastes, besides my dad is a chef. Never to go back again.
author: uncle m.

description:
I took my Pops here for Daddy's Day. Dad is hard to please - when I take him out he often growls "I could make this ten times better!" -  but even he was impressed by the dishes. We had the deep fried sanddab (a little dry for my taste), sauteed green beans (getting better) and black pepper steak cubes with scallops (truly magnificent - oh so tender!). 

The restaurant has a clean look and its decor uses expensive materials. There are acres of space here, plus many banquet tables. One con is the service. I found a curly hair in my rice bowl, and asked the waitress to bring me another bowl. Seconds later, my Dad found a hair in his rice! He threw a fit. The waitress rushed over and swiped the hair. She placed it in the palm of the manager, who happened to be walking by. Mr. Manager shrugged and walked away. Yes, this is that kind of restaurant -- if you're not in a group of 8 or you're not a pushy Occidental you'll have to resign yourself to picking hair out of your food.

Finally, the prices are a tad steep. Empero Taste must be passing on the cost of adding the missing "r's".
author: William L.

description:
This place used to be a dirty and mediocre establishment for Chinese food. It was so bad that my brother found what looks like a "booger" in his vegetables. After that, we never came back.

Now, it's different. Way different! The restaurant is cleaner and brighter! There's a more friendlier waiting staff and the food is good for another visit! Point to note: it might feel a little tight in some parts of the restaurant.

If you know what to order for Chinese food, good for you! I'm just going to point out the dishes that are worth mentioning and skip the rest, which aren't bad at all.

The dish to get is the Bay Fung Tong crab. The crab is chopped up into pieces, coated with a seasoned batter and fried till there's a lovely light crunch! There are bits of minced beef topped over it, but the crab is a winner. There's plenty of crab meat in each piece and the shell is cracked enough to seal the flavor and yet easy to take apart. The batter gives an extra flavor that isn't overpowering to the crab. I don't know if that is their specialty, but it sure is worth talking about! 

I mentioned this earlier regarding another Chinese restaurant and it's best to mention it again. I feel like every Chinese restaurant degrades as head chefs move on with their lives, so don't expect my ratings to stay consistent for a long time! Check the date of this review before you consider taking my current opinion of this restaurant as part of your decision to dine here. I've seen plenty of Chinese restaurant fall in quality, so try this while the food is good and the restaurant is clean and vermin-free!!
author: Jeremy L.

description: No more dim sum. :( They still have clams in black bean sauce, green beans are aways good, shrimp and walnuts, and noodle dishes. Stuffed mushrooms are stuffed with fish paste, not shrimp. No more hot chicken feet, only cold chicken feet. So sad.
author: Mary H.

description:
Food is typical Chinese, cheap and pretty good, but the worst thing about having a table in front is that if it is packed and crowded as it was on the night that we were there, is that people if they are waiting, they come into the restaurant and wait standing on your table pretty much.  How would you like to eat with people standing with their front leaning and touching the back of your chair.  Pretty much their chin is right above your head! 

Creepy.  

I like my space and this place doesn't give me that. So that kinda negates the goodness of the good especially in a city where there are tons of good cheap Chinese places.  

Sorry Empero Taste I really want to make you one of my "go to" places for Chinese but not under such conditions.
author: Denise B.

description:
Personally I say that there are 2 factors in determining how "good" a restaurant is, the service and obviously the food itself.  Empero Taste has definitely satisfied these 2 factors for me.

The service was wonderful!  Everyone was welcoming and they made sure that you were enjoying your dining experience there.  I've heard that the restaurant is under new management so maybe that has something to do with it.  Not entirely sure on this.  

The food was excellent too!  I had the French style steak cubes and lobster with noodles and both were really good.  Pretty tender and juicy overall, and best of all the dishes didn't really feel too fattening.  I think they use a smaller amount of oil for their dishes.  

Definitely give this restaurant a try if you are in the area!
author: Kelvin C.

description: Horrible service. Food sucks. The young girl with glasses has a attitude problem and forgot some of out orders!!
author: Richie W.

description:
I used to come here with my family a lot back when it was called "something...Panda", my grandparents were huge fans. I never could wrap my head around why it was their favorite or why they felt it was so much better than any restaurant on clement, i figure it was because of the close proximity from the house to the restaurant. I just went to the new "panda" which is called Empero Taste, not bad...about the same as I remember just much cleaner. 

Tips and Pointers:
-Try the salt and peppered pork chop, best thing they have here...truth
-Much cleaner than before, as well as better furnished
-Looks a lot newer than the old restuarant
-Prices are cheap
-Food is great quality, service is fast, prices are good. 'Nuff said.

[APPROVED]
author: Eric T.

description: went to this place after we went bike riding in golden gate park, everyone was crazy hungry so we ordered one of the specials, it was the $108 special or whatever.  I ordered the kung pao tofu and some fried spring rolls, the kung pao tofu was extremely bland even though i told them to make it spicy, the fried spring rolls were great.  i saw all the other dishes that came out and my friends all enjoyed the walnut prawns, and the crab, other than that they said that the rest of the food was kinda bland, we were supposed to get a desert with out special but the waiter came by and told us that they didn't have it.  the service in there is pretty bad.  i wouldn't go back again.
author: Maninderpal M.

description: This place is alright, there are some stellar dishes, but for the most part the dishes are all average quality and taste. The XO stir fry noodles with beef stew was amazing and the beef shank cubes were tasty. I wouldn't recommend the dim sum here, it's pricey and doesn't taste that great.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I think someone forgot the "R" at the end of Empero b/c it means "nevertheless" in Spanish. 

I believe the owners are still the same from the previous Best Panda establishment. Out of convenience, we had our Mother's Day dim sum there. Sure the place is clean due to the renovation and new chairs but the food was so salty I had to keep my tea cup close.

Don't expect much service either b/c I asked for vinegar with the potstickers and it took me asking 4x before it was brought. 

If you are going to charge higher than average prices, please at least make good food and not the "Nevertheless Taste".
author: Katie K.

description: Great chowmein, but super oily food and must have tons of msg as I've passed out cold twice after eating here! Customers are regulars who line up outside the door in the pouring rain to wait so I guess they love it..
author: DeAnne A.

description:
The Artist Formerly Known as Best Panda is by far the best tasting traditional Chinese place in the Richmond. Here's what the girlfriend and I ALWAYS order (and are constantly food coma satisfied): curry chicken, shrimp fried rice, and the sauteed green beans. Nothing like good ol' chinese comfort food to make everything alright!

The remodel did WONDERS. Now it's both great tasting AND clean. Double whammy.
author: Wally N.

description: So the son left and sold the place but it seems the food tasted the same.  The menu have  been shorten which is an improvement because it was a little too lengthy like reading a book.  The price have increased like everything in this city.  The staff is new and not very experience but they are kind and have good manners.  Not very organized in delivering service, on the slow side then again the wait was worth it because everything is delicious.  I never have a problem with upset stomach or tummy ache the way I have with other establishment when I suspect cleanliness problems or greasiness. Thumbs up for E.T.  I see other customers ordering seafood and vegi for dinner.  Their seafood is very reasonably priced;I like their shrimps and fried fish.  Their rice plate is cheap ($5.50) but you get what you pay for simple big plate of rice with a little meat in there.  Still filling and delicious on a budget.  The only downside that they have is the acoustic once again I mentioned before this place is noisy even when its not full.  I wish I live closer to ET because I am living way across town.  Even if you don't order their $19 for 3 items dinner, I picked 3 items(free dessert) and under $19 not include tips or tax , walking out full belly so  This is one of my fave chinese place!
author: Mar H.

description: My dad is the dim sum chef here, so I'm biased =). The food is very much home-style cooking - literally they are what we eat at home, minus the serving spoons on each dish because we like to use chopsticks to directly attack the food! Everything is cheap and delicious, and the desserts (mango pudding, red bean 'soup', tortoise jelly) are amazing, which is pretty rare because most cheap Chinese restaurants are quite weak when it comes to the dessert menu, if they have any.
author: Michelle N.

description:
It's been over 3 years, so my wife wanted to try it again.  It's near our house, so we ordered to go food on the way home.  We were told that it would be ready in 15 minutes.  My wife gets talking to one of her friends, so we show up 30 minutes later.  Food wasn't ready yet.

If you think it is going to be 30 minutes, just tell us that it will be 30 minutes.  Luckily, this time we didn't have to wait as long.
author: Anthony T.

description: I love this restaurant. Is it the best Chinese food in the world? No, it is not. But it's WELL above average in quality and cheaper than it has any right to be. A whole list of big $5 entrees? Three entrees for $20? Feeding a group of ten people for $70 at a nice sit down restaurant with ambiance, decent (but not great) service, good food, and leftovers? That's a revelation.
author: chris c.

description:
So had a large party taking up 2 round banquet tables, was a little tight but we like it cozy.  My Aunt and Uncle were feeling extra lavish and doubled ordered for both tables ahead of time, basically 4 group orders, we love food.  AND THIS IS WHAT HAPPENED NEXT:  all 10 courses came out within the first 15 minutes!!!!   

     Let's break this down, 40 plates came out before even one plate of food was finished!  Not a joke.  I had then sat in my seat no more than 10 minutes from entering the restaurant and our lazy susan was full, no time to chat or visit with fellow guests.  For those of you who don't know how large a lazy susan is, 20 plates will not fit, I'd say maximum 8 medium size plates.  Yes we double ordered, so adjust, give us a slower plate progression, pretty simple idea.  Don't punish us.  So our waiters stacked our dishes as best they could and what did they do with the rest of the backed up food, they let them sit on an adjacent empty table until there was room.  Who likes cold food?  Not for me.  Not for anyone.  Besides, usually plates come out every 3-5 minutes, everyone ooo's and aahhh's at it, add's a little comment like "Oh that's my favorite."  Nope.  Not this time.  So we munched and munched trying to clear dishes as fast as we could so that those poor lonely dishes on the side table could eventually join the party and hopefully keep a flash of warmth.  They brought out large fish and duck dishes (usually the high points of a banquet meal), saw they could not fit on the susan, and chopped up good looking food and dumped it  on smaller plates to make due.   Spent most of the night quickly chewing our food while playing the most complicated game of Chinese Banquet Lazy Susan Plate Management (not sold in stores) i have ever played.

     Still venting here.  So imagine this scene: we sit, a frenzy of waiters march out an entire ready made feast before we could swallow a single bite, my elder asian relatives attempt to convey their fears and shock, then poof; the servers disappear.  Well easy night for the waiters huh, got that party taken care of, now on to other more important customers with fatter wallets.  

     About the food.  Better than average Chinese food I eat when we go out banquet style.  Walnut shrimp and deep fried pork dishes best, duck little too fatty, fish and veggie dishes bit overcooked, still overall good food.  Main concerns: more salt than I'm used to and later dishes cold for the above mentioned reasons.

     Paranoid, dangerous, politically incorrect thought following:  we have a happa family, most of the White side showed up first.  Could they have noticed this and assumed they could pull this blatantly bad service on us and White people couldn't read the situation?  Boy were they in for an earful when the rest of the Asians showed up.  My family has been dining out banquet style since the Ming Dynasty, never been treated like this.  

     Closing thought: this place could have served the best food ever but if you have the feeling that you are not wanted and are a burden and nuisance to the establishment, you are not going to have a good time.  And yes I created a Yelp account just to express this displeasure.   Goodnight.
author: Julian F.

description: Still a great place to go.  I've been going here since it was Best Panda and the food and service are still great!  The food can sometimes be a bit greasy, but at least you know that they're not cheap and sacrificing taste to save money.  Their lunch menu is the bomb!
author: Joseph C.

description: My family and I frequent this restaurant. The food is good and the portions are large. The 3 entrees for 19.99 is a good buy. Service is above average. I really like their dim sum menu but has been discontinued but will come back for lunch or dinner.
author: Steven J.

description:
Great Chinese!  I've gone quite a few times with family and they always seems to deliver.  This is actually one of my favorite places.  5 stars based on food; of course service in a Chinese Restaurant is always lacking but if you're assertive they will get what you need.

Their chinese style calamari is excellent and the portions are huge compared to price.  I'm talking about a massive pile of deep fried goodness with delectable bits of garlic, salt, and peppers... mmmm....  none of this small ring bullshit, they slice the squid into flat pieces which IMHO is superior to all other methods.

They brought out a Sweet Garlic Chicken Wing dish that was very good.  This is a dish we would typically bypass but I'm glad it was on the menu.  Now one of my top favorites at this restaurant.  

Everything else is good to very good including pea sprouts that aren't too oily and tasty stews.  

Bottom line is if you are in the mood for some solid chinese, none of this fried rice, chow mein, sweet and sour chicken bullshit but real Bay Area chinese, definitely head out to Empero Taste!
author: Micah W.

description: I live right down the street so it is very convenient and the food is good.  BUT, I now see that they have turtles on their menu and I find this to be disturbing.  I will not support any restaurant that has turtles on the menu!!!
author: Matt G.

description: Empero Taste=nom nom nom for a late Chinese/Lunar New Year.  We were all so excited to come together as a family.  We were cracking jokes, talking loud, laughing at one of the male relatives that went into the women's bathroom (and didn't care).  When the food came out though, you could hear a pin drop for at least 20 minutes b/c we were stuffing the food down our faces.  We ordered a 6 person dinner and added a few dishes for the eight of us.  Dishes included some of my all time Chinese favs: black bean clams, lobster, salt and pepper fried porkchops, dried beef chow fun, etc.  The only thing left was of course, the veggies lol.  We love this place so much that we will return for the pooled birthday celebrations soon!  On a positive note, this place is fairly clean for being really affordable/cheap Chinese food.  Don't let the price fool you, the taste is not compromised.  I can't wait to tear it up next visit!!
author: Steph W.

description: this the place if you want to get some bomb ass dim sum for the price, forget about koi palace which is over rated to start with... we spend about $60 for 5 people and we was full when we left, there was so many food for just $1.80 a plate... doesn't matter if its small, medium, or large... still $1.80, you can't go wrong... place doesn't even look run down either, beautiful and modern :)
author: JessePanda C.

description:
Empero haiku:
haiku is the plural of...haiku

Empero I eat
For dinner with my fam'ly
I am very stuffed

I had a wo choi
A lot of food came to me
We paid thirty eight

The waitstaff too nice
They seem to know what I need
Super quick service

What is an Emp'ro
Maybe one day I'll find out
For now mystery
author: tammy m.

description: Great food for a great price!  It can be a little cold in there, so bring a jacket.  You can get more variety if there's 4+ people so you can share the different dishes.  Great for typical big "10 people per table" family dinners.  I've never tried the dim sum - only dinner...
author: Jennie L.

description:
My family used to come here often when it was Best Panda.  We even came here a few times after it was changed to Empero Taste.  My dad l likes this place out of nostalgia (the owners are the same).  

One gripe, which is the main reason for the 1 star rating, is the service.  There's a lot of staff but they seem to do much of nothing.  The food took forever.  I mean, I go to a restaurant to eat.  Not to sit there twirling my thumbs downing cups of tea for lack of any food to eat. 

They sat us down immediately, but it took them 10 minutes to come take our order.  We had to wave the waiter down to do that.    After our order was taken we were ignored pretty much for the entire time.   35 minutes later and still nothing on the table.  Ridiculous.  No explanation.  I almost thought they forgot about us.  They were busy, but I'm not going to make excuses for other people's incompetencies.

I liked this place.  I really did.  I don't know what the hell happened.  Left a bitter sweet taste in my mouth b/c I enjoyed the food, but the slow paced service is enough to make me never want to return.  Ever.
author: Jeanne L.

description: I come here about once a month since it's so close to my grandparents' house.  They love bringing in their own fresh fish & seafood and the restaurant cooks it for us for a very small or no fee depending on what it is.  The food is alright except sometimes i feel like they deep fry stuff randomly regardless of the description given.  We normally get these large white clams that are two half shells (or one clam) for $2.50 and it's cooked with glass noodles & garlic. delicious! However, once in a while, they end up deep frying those too.
author: Grace H.

description:
Not sure why this place only has three stars, because it's definitely one of the best Chinese restaurants I've ever eaten at, and I've been to a lot. If you know what/how to order, you can have a great meal here at a VERY reasonable price. The salt and pepper chicken wings and salt and pepper squid are standouts, but pretty much everything on the menu is good. The flavor is good, the portions are generous, and the prices are low...what more could you ask for?

Parking can be kind of a pain (it's San Francisco...go figure), but it's definitely worth the hassle. Don't let these bad user reviews fool you -- this is one of the best Chinese restaurants in San Francisco. People complaining about service can stick to P.F. Chang's -- I'll eat the real Chinese food.
author: Ryan T.

description:
its some good ole cheap and good dim sum. for lunch time.. you just pick the items that you want. its very traditional dim sum. the prices are cheap. s are a 1.80. m are 2.20. although i think the portions are a bit small. i think the chicken feet only came with three feet last time. boo..i really like the Egg Yolk custard bun. thats really good.. not too many dim sum places have it. 

for dinner... they cook really well. its descent. i think we got the spare ribs and some other dishes... i'd come back again for dim sum and for dinner. although sometimes the wait really sucks...
author: Darren C.

description:
I totally think this Dim Sum place is underrated on Yelp.

My friends and I went to Empero last Saturday for Dim Sum.  For less than $24 we ordered 6 dim sum dishes and a plate of the House Special Chow Fun (wide flat noodles).  It was super yummy and we had leftovers.  The BBQ steamed buns are the best I ever had.
author: Iheartcamels Y.

description:
I went there for tea and dinner before. I would definitely say No! to this place. Especially if there's a ugly , mad young dude there behind the cashier. I have no idea what he's doing there, he did nothing but yelling at other waiters. I am like, shut up, why dont you just do ur thing! Arent u working here?  So annoying. 

The food are very salty! No a healthy sauce. Unless u fullfill ur salt quota for the whole week.

I had the black bean clam, it's like a soup! Way to many sauce and taste bad! 

and we have some other fry course as well, and looks like they havent changed their oil for decades! 

The last we had it's the fry rice! Nth special but just whole bunch for garage fry with rice.

There is nth good at all! People dun go!
author: Phoebe C.

description: I just went back today, this time with my co workers and They loved it. We ordered a bunch of dishes and some dim sum and the bill was 40 dollars. What else can u ask for wen u have awesome tasty food for such a good price. Very good portions and no msg. tat freaken rocks.
author: Jonathan W.

description: The beef tendon is addictive.  It's just yummy.  It makes me salivate.  Give it a try -- it's in the clay pot section.
author: JC R.

description: Waahhhh, no more Best Panda.Best Panda was my standby for cheap good eats. It's been replaced by a prettier and cleaner place. But the food does not have the same oomph as their predecessor.  Sometimes change isn't good
author: Sophia C.

description: Heard that empero taste cud have been that cheap dim sum I used to go on balboa/6th ave. The venue was nice and clean and the service staff were prompt and friendly. I appreciated their big bowl of warm soup upon getting seated! Their dim sum deals are pretty good with some dishes priced at $1.80. Loved the shrimp rice rolls...shrimp was succulent and fresh , har gow was good too with thin translucent skin. Enjoyed the crispy beancurd skin roll w black bean sauce and it must be good when a usually finicky 2 yr old loves it! The spicy fried squid was so tasty too! Was a tad dissapointed in the  ee Fu noodles though... Didn't seem like it was braised long enough to soak in all the yummy marinade. But this place is definitely worth a visit if u are coming to balboa.
author: Topazskye L.

description:
What happened to this place. It was decent as of a month ago, but last weekend was just terrible. The only reason why this place gets two stars is b/c the service was better than expected. 

Back to the food. I ordered salt/pepper pork chop, hot and sour soup, and live fish. Hot and sour soup had some nasty fatty globs of pork in it. The pork chop was mostly fat. The live fish was over-cooked with very little sauce.

I ended up just paying the bill and leaving without eating more than a few bites of each item. Ended up going to Yu-zen next door for dinner instead. What a dissapointment. I should have gone to Yu-zen to begin with, rather than paying for two dinners.

I hope Empero improves the quality of food...
author: Roger R.

description:
Empero Taste has fresh, tasty, and cheap Chinese food. The more "authentic" the dish, often the better it is here. The pea shoots are yummy, the surf clam is really better than most seafood I've had even at pricey restaurants, and the tofu dishes are excellently saucy. At these prices, you obviously are not going to get the best cuts of meat (and besides, most Chinese homecooking prizes chewy tendons), but the food is fresh and well-seasoned. 

Service is fast. When Danny is in the house, it's friendly and efficient. When he's not around, it's every person for themselves. We sometimes leave if the place is crowded and he's not there.

I've been to a lot of cheap Chinese places in San Francisco, and this is the best I've found outside of Stockton Street.
author: Jo Ellen K.

description: Food is great!   We usually order the Honey Walnut Prawns, and Empero Chicken (half).  I've only eaten in once and the staff seemed attentive; great speedy service too.  We usually take out though but the food is priced reasonably and they have it ready for you in 10 minutes.  I'll no doubt keep coming back.^^
author: Yoko N.

description: Went there this past Tuesday for dinner. We ordered the $88 set price menu. The best part of the meal was the Beef cubes/Scallop dish and the Mixed meat clay pot. Service was effiecient. Price was fair. Place was clean...I would have given this place a 4 star, but I saw something that I'll keep to myself. 3 1/2 stars overall.
author: Peter L.

description:
I JUST came back from this place, and oh my ghawd was I satisfied. First off, bf and I ordered WAAAAAY too much. Thank god they ran out of the green beans or else we'd have another to-go box stashed away in our fridge. 
Anyways, the service was very friendly. Even though we ordered a lot they still joked with us (and not stared disgustingly like I half expected, although I'm sure they're gonna gossip now that we're not there LOL!). It wasn't very awkward, and I have a feeling that if we didn't order so much the service would have been just as good. 
The food was really good, the one thing I didn't notice in their food was the all too common overpowering taste of salt. Unfortunately the majority of the 'good' dim sum places in San Francisco are pressured into adding salt to their dishes because the 'American' pallet doesn't like anything without salt in it, but OH GOD if you put MSG in it. [Mini rant over] We ordered chinese broccoli (which was steamed to perfection), sue mai (haven't tried it yet, but bf said he didn't like it...), chicken feet (delishiiooouuus!), beef in rice noodle (alright), mushu pork (first time ever having it, I really liked the veggies), turn up cakes (haven't tried it yet), fried pot stickers (alright), shrimp dumplings (didn't try it yet), fried beef spare ribs (hecka gooood, but salty), and custard balls (which we haven't tried yet either, LOL). For all that we paid just under $40, and we left a $6 tip. I liked it :3
author: Allie W.

description: just went there today and was surprised to see the place wasn't jumping as it normally would at lunch time on a Sunday.  found out they no longer serve diem sum and from what i gathered the owners sold out...too bad.
author: Rose R.

description:
Gee some people are rude with their reviews.  Let's be fair.  We eat at Empero Taste approximately 3 times a week for the following reasons:

1.  The prices are hard to beat.  
2.  The food has consistent quality.
3.  The service is also consistent.

We have probably tried over 20 dishes on this restaurant's menu, including the Egg and Shrimp Omelet, Honey Walnut Prawns, Mongolian Beef, Chicken with Vegetables, Beef with Green Beans, Kung Pao Chicken, Sesame Fried Chicken, Shredded Pork with Bean Sprouts, Mango Pudding, Coconut Pudding.  I love the Honey Walnut Prawns and Mongolian Beef.  

The daily dinner specials are $4.95 and include rice. The dining area is spacious and clean and service is always fine.  Really, how do you beat this?  We also love Mayflower and other upscale Chinese but for value, this place is hard to beat.  The only thing we weren't so fond of was the fried chicken, which was a little sweet for our taste.
author: M R.

description: I have been to this location several times through the constant ownership changes.  The restaurant was remodeled again which is a great change because the floors used to be very slippery.  The food was good and tasted consistent for Cantonese cuisine.  My family ordered the set meal with ten courses.  The whole fried Chicken was very tasty and this is a strong indication of a good cook.  The food was not overly salty and did not have a strong MSG taste.
author: Ginny M.

description: I can here for dim sum and it was okay. The prices for the weekday were inexpensive so I had to try it. The food was not as tasty as I like it. A little bland. The interior however is very clean and nicely kept. I recommend a try.
author: Leon C.

description: I was not satisfied. Maybe I just got done eating a good Japanese meal, so going to Chinese food which I'm not a fan of anyway.. was a bigger disappointment than usual. But anyway, the shrimp was not fresh in the soup. The clams were supposedly fresh, but I felt that they were small in size. The rest of the dishes I tried weren't amusing at all. The only things that were good to me were the walnut prawns (do-a-ble) and the quails (which were good). I'll round it up at the 2 stars for it's simple, but bright decor (not bad for a Chinese restaurant) and the really nice busboy.
author: Elaine H.

description: Okay, maybe I went on a good day, or they realized their prices were ridiculous. I don't have such a major grudge against them anymore.
author: Alex Y.

description: My first visit was earlier today. I cannot complain about the price. It's reasonable and the food taste is well just many Chinese restaurant. My biggest pet peeve was the dishes was brought to us at approx 7 minutes interval on average. I had to wait about 10 minutes on one dish we ordered. By the time the wait was over, the food, that was brought out earlier, has turned cold. Basically, I was eating cold diner.
author: T H.

description:
We went for lunch today.  It was really cheap and I was surprised.  The dim sum was pretty good and the interior of this place was much much better than outside.
Food was NOT oily and four women spend only $4 each (including tax/ tip)!! Amazing and we felt that we found a good cheap eat.
author: Miinno N.

description: this place is the best food is good price is right wtf u do u want?
author: Riz Q.

description: Good Chinese food. This place is always crowded. Most of the time they have really good service. A great place to bring family and friends.
author: lilpandagirl P.

description:
cheap food for the price.
 
$5 rice plates!! that is the best. if you speak to them in chinese, they will usually give you more food.
author: Nathaniel L.

description: um....my family loves it!!! always go there because it is cheap and big portion. everytime my family go will order one fish that make 2 dishes and 1 soup. very good deal. be4 this place was so dirty. now is getting better. i am not a big fan of it, but i am ok with it. good for family.
author: B B.

description: I had dinner tonight and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food. The restaurant was packed and the food on the other tables looked fresh and delicious. We opted for the set dinner for 3 people and added on the ying yang fried rice. It was all very good and very reasonable. The total bill came around $40. The interior is much cleaner and brighter than the old Best Panda restaurant and they even have a waiting area now. i was also impressed that they had some nice highchairs for kids, not typical of the usual Chinese restaurants that I've been to. We will definitely be returning again!
author: Keromi K.

description: I've been here several times recently for dim sum and it's quite good.  Much better deal than some of the other options in the Richmond.  Fried rice or chow fun noodles for $4.95; decent shanghai dumplings, etc.  Worth a visit, and no lines on weekends.
author: John G.

description: Slightly different owner than Best Panda.  It's the former owners son, Danny.  They are trying to make it better. And, Danny said he is going to lower the prices.  Some of the same cooks/staff are on board, but some left due to the shutdown to make changes in the decor, etc.  As for the food, yes, the clams w/bb was a little salty, but the flavor was there and so were the clams.  The sand dabs could have been better.  Lots of bok choy, not too much "dabs".  But the oyster claypot was a hit.  Give them a little time and I think they might come around.
author: AJ L.

description: Tonight I went back to Empero Taste to give them another chance.  I have been there for lunch a few times and for dinner once, when it was first open.  Last few times, I was disappointed but felt that they have some potential (at least the place was very clean).  Tonight I was finally happy.  The place is still nothing fancy but if you are looking for an authentic Cantonese seafood restaurant for family style eating, this is not a bad place.  The food is tasty and the price is very reasonable.  Most customers are Chinese and many of the special items on the menu are printed in Chinese only.  But the waiting staff and the captain speak English and they seem eager to provide good service.  They have the usual American-Chinese items but if you are adventurous, you can try their goose intestines and sea cucumbers, etc.  In the back of the menu, they also have the prix fix dinner for three, four, six and eight people.  I had their dinner for four tonight which comes with soup, sweet and sour pork, steamed razor clams, seafood stir fry and deep fried squab plus dessert (for $38 !!!).  Since we don't eat beef, we ask them to change their beef egg flower soup to sizzling rice soup with shrimp, and there was no problem.  This is not a place for everyone.  But if you are looking for good food, good value, authentic experience, lots of parking, and a place inside Outer Richmond, then look no further.  At least try it while it is still clean.
author: Denny K M.
